page.title: 14THE VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: RODINGTON SCHOOL IS A CHURCH OF ENGLAND PRIMARY SCHOOL CONTROLLED BY SHROPSHIRE L. E. A. AND THEREFORE, FINANCED BY THEM. WHEN THE SCHOOL WAS FIRST OPENED IN 1849, ONLY 4 MANAGERS WERE APPOINTED, THE RECTOR, A GENTLEMAN, AND 2 FARMERS. THEY WERE RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL EXPENSES, BOOKS, STATIONERY, SALARIES AND REPAIRS. A NEW INSTRUMENT OF GOVERNMENT COMES INTO EFFECT IN SEPTEMBER 1985. THERE WILL BE 8 GOVERNORS, 9 IF THE HEAD ELECTS TO BE A GOVERNOR. THE SCHOOL HAS TWO FULL-TIME TEACHERS, A COOK, A CLEANER, A DINNER LADY AND AN ANCILLARY FOR FIVE HOURS SECRETARIAL WORK A WEEK. THERE ARE 35 CHILDREN ON ROLL. THERE ARE 2 CLASSES,THE INFANTS, AGED FROM 5 TO 7 YEARS AND THE JUNIORS, AGED FROM 7 TO 11 YEARS. THE FUTURE OF THE SCHOOL WILL BE IN DOUBT IF THE NUMBER ON ROLL DROPS BELOW 30.
